definition: Book of Exodus/Second Book of Moses

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
abbr. for Egypt 埃及[Ai1 ji2]
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: The Israelites vow that they'll obey  Exodus 24:3, also 7b.
sentences.chinese: 在《出埃及记》第24章第3节诗7b中。
在出埃及记第一章，第九节。

sentences.english: As a foundation of a national identity, this is Moses-leading-the-Jews-of-out-Egypt type stuff.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个国家认同的基础，类似于摩西的出埃及记。

sentences.english: That place is the Ten Commandments, found in Exodus 20.
sentences.chinese: 这个地方就是圣经十诫，出自《出埃及记》第20章。

sentences.english: Which Biblical figure led the exodus from Egypt?
sentences.chinese: 是哪个圣经人物带领了出埃及记？

sentences.english: He says he seeks to give the two central institutions of Torah.
sentences.chinese: 他说，他试图找到《出埃及记》中最中心的两个机构。

sentences.english: The Exodus story also contains many Egyptian elements.
sentences.chinese: 出埃及记》故事中也有大量的埃及元素。

sentences.english: Of course, this includes the Ten Commandments found in Exodus 20.
sentences.chinese: 无疑这其中包括出埃及记20中的十戒。

sentences.english: The book of Exodus is really the sequel, then, to the book of Genesis.
sentences.chinese: 出埃及记》其实是《创世纪》的续篇。

definition: Book of Deuteronomy/Fifth Book of Moses
Book of Genesis/First Book of Moses
Book of Numbers/Fourth Book of Moses
Book of Job (in the Old Testament)
Book of Leviticus/Third Book of Moses
the Revelation of St John the divine/the Apocalypse
